questions.text: The notion of a mental map involves:
options: a series of photographs of physical surroundings
a cognitive representation of physical space
a photographic memory of all visual experiences
questions.correctAnswer: a cognitive representation of physical space

questions.text: Which of the following is most likely to be used when solving a problem with a clearly defined goal and a well-known solution method?
Which type of problem-solving strategy involves trying different solutions in no particular order, without any clear strategy?
Which problem-solving approach is characterized by repeatedly breaking down a problem into smaller, more manageable parts?
In analogical problem-solving, people attempt to solve a problem based on:
options: a solution from a completely unrelated domain
a mental image of the goal
a solution that is similar to a problem they have already solved
a physical representation of the problem
questions.correctAnswer: a solution that is similar to a problem they have already solved

questions.text: According to the representativeness heuristic, people are likely to judge an event as more probable if it:
options: is more representative of their own experiences
seems more typical of a category they know
questions.correctAnswer: seems more typical of a category they know

questions.text: The tendency to make decisions based on how easily an example comes to mind is known as the:
A person who believes that a series of coin tosses should balance out, even though they are independent events, is demonstrating:
Which cognitive bias involves placing too much importance on the first piece of information encountered when making decisions?
The confirmation bias leads individuals to:
options: actively search for information that contradicts their beliefs
interpret ambiguous information in a neutral way
seek out information that confirms their preexisting beliefs
rely more on evidence that is equally weighted from all sources
questions.correctAnswer: seek out information that confirms their preexisting beliefs
